subject: Re: amys back
author: psi_research
full_text:
Hey Vicki, I did get a Luminator photo. Mine appeared a bit dark but I 
should examine it again. 

I was equally impressed with Alex MacRae and Paolo Presi for their 
keen scientific scrutiny of the phenomenon. Even under close 
examination, some submitted EVP's appear to be genuine paranormal 
phenomenon. EVP recordings are being subjected to some of the most 
vigorous digital forensic analysis techniques available. Of course, 
many supposed EVP's can be debunked, but those considered supernatural 
in origin are classified as such due to audio characteristics that to 
not comply with our physical world as science currently understands 
it. I would recommend any of the doubters to not jump to conclusions 
until reviewing the work of some of these great researchers. 

Better yet, I recommend attempting to record EVP's themselves. Be 
patient, but diligent. Nothing convinces a person faster than personal 
experience.

Cheers, Bill

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Vicki Talbott <vtalbott1@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Bill,
>   Good to see you here!  Enjoyed our lunch together and the 
conference.  Some of those presentations were excellent, weren't 
they?  did you get a luminator picture with Mark Macy?  If so, did you 
get anything in it?  Take care, Vicki
> 
> William Murphy <vilhellm@...> wrote:
>             Hello Frank, those who are advancing the study of EVP's 
will likely always face the critics and doubters. Imagine what Tesla, 
Edison, Ford, the Wright brothers, and all the pioneers and early 
adopters have had to deal with. 
>    
>   Vicki, it's been nice reading your post. I am still absorbing all 
the presentations including yours I heard at the AA-EVP Conference in 
Atlanta. I was your lunch time pal, Bill Murphy.
>
